      Allocates one or more new (and empty) items in the store.

      Retrieves a given data item, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster.
      If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior.

      • alloc

        public long alloc(int count,
         co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
           throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                  co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Allocates one or more new (and empty) items in the store.

        When allocating a single item, it's better to use put(), but some data structures might require allocating an array of items.

        Specified by:
        alloc in interface Store
        Parameters:
        count - The number of items to allocate.
        txn - The current transaction. May not be null.
        Returns:
        The id of the first item in the allocated array. The following count - 1 IDs belong to the following elements of the array.
        Throws:
        co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException
        co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution

      • put

        public long put(byte[] data,
       co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
         throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Puts a new item into the store and returns its (newly allocated) ID.

        Specified by:
        put in interface Store
        Parameters:
        data - The item's contents.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The item's (newly allocated) ID.
        Throws:
        co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • get

        public byte[] get(long id,
         short nodeHint)
           throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                  co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Retrieves a given data item, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Store
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        nodeHint - The ID of the node the data item is probably owned by.
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.
        co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution

      • getFromOwner

        public byte[] getFromOwner(long id,
                  long ownerOf)
                    throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                           co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Retrieves a given data item, using a hint as to its owner in the cluster. Unlike the direct hint given in get(long, short), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Specified by:
        getFromOwner in interface Store
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.
        co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution

        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.

      • gets

        public byte[] gets(long id,
          co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
            throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                   co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Retrieves a given data item, and pins the shared (cached) instance to this node. What this means is that while other nodes will be able to read the same item, no node will be able to update it until until we end the transaction or release it.
        Specified by:
        gets in interface Store
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:

        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.

      • getsFromOwner

        public byte[] getsFromOwner(long id,
                   long ownerOf,
                   co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
                     throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                            co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, and pins the shared (cached) instance to this node. What this means is that while other nodes will be able to update it until until we end the transaction or release it. Unlike the direct hint given in Store.gets(long, short, StoreTransaction), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Specified by:
        getsFromOwner in interface Store
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.
        co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution

      • getsFromOwner

        public void getsFromOwner(long id,
                 long ownerOf,
                 co.paralleluniverse.common.io.Persistable object,
                 co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
                   throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                          co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, and pins the shared (cached) instance to this node. What this means is that while other nodes will be able to read the same item, no node will be able to update it until until we end the transaction or release it.
        Unlike the direct hint given in Store.gets(long, short, Persistable, StoreTransaction), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Specified by:
        getsFromOwner in interface Store
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Throws:
        co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.
        co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution

          co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
            throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                   co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Retrieves a given data item, makes this node its exclusive owner, and pins it. What this means is that no other node will be able to read or update the same item until until we end the transaction or release it. it.

        getx in interface Store
        Parameters:

        co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution

          co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
            throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                   co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, makes this node its exclusive owner, and pins it. What this means is that no other node will be able to read or update the same item until until we end the transaction or release it.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Specified by:
        getx in interface Store
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        nodeHint - The ID of the node the data item is probably owned by.

      • getxFromOwner

        public byte[] getxFromOwner(long id,
                   long ownerOf,
                   co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
                     throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                            co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, makes this node its exclusive owner, and pins it. What this means is that no other node will be able to read or update the same item until we end the transaction or release it. Unlike the direct hint given in Store.getx(long, short, StoreTransaction), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Specified by:
        getxFromOwner in interface Store
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Returns:
        The contents of the item.
        Throws:
        co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.
        co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution

      • getxFromOwner

        public void getxFromOwner(long id,
                 long ownerOf,
                 co.paralleluniverse.common.io.Persistable object,
                 co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
                   throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                          co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Retrieves a given data item with a hint as to its owner in the cluster, makes this node its exclusive owner, and pins it. What this means is that no other node will be able to read or update the same item until we end the transaction or release it. Unlike the direct hint given in Store.getx(long, short, Persistable, StoreTransaction), the hinted node here is the owner of a given item.
        If the item is indeed found on the hinted node, the retrieval performance might be superior. If not, the method will still work, but performance may be worse.
        Specified by:
        getxFromOwner in interface Store
        Parameters:
        id - The item's ID.
        ownerOf - The ID of an item whose owner is probably the owner of the requested item as well.
        object - The object into which the contents of the item will be written.
        txn - The current transaction. May be null, in which case you must later call release(id).
        Throws:
        co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.
        co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution

      • set

        public void set(long id,
       byte[] data,
       co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
         throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException,
                co.paralleluniverse.fibers.SuspendExecution
        Description copied from interface: Store

      • release

        public void release(long id)
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Releases a line that's been pinned to this node by one of the gets, getx, put operations.

        This method must be called to release a line used in one of the gets, getx, put operations, if they were called with a null transaction.

        Specified by:
        release in interface Store

      • getRoot

        public long getRoot(String rootName,
           co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.StoreTransaction txn)
             throws co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Gets or possibly creates a root data item. The same item ID will be returned when this method is called on any cluster node with the same root name.

        You can test if the root has been newly created by this transaction by calling .

        Specified by:
        getRoot in interface Store
        Parameters:
        rootName - The root's name.
        txn - The current transaction. May not be null.
        Returns:
        The root item's ID.
        Throws:
        co.paralleluniverse.galaxy.TimeoutException - This exception is thrown if the operation has times-out.

      • push

        public void push(long id,
        short... toNodes)
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Makes the given item available in the given nodes' cache.
        While this method is never necessary for the correct operation of the grid, in some special circumstances it might improve performance if we know that the given nodes will soon be interested in reading the item (e.g. as a result of a message we're about to send them).
        Specified by:
        push in interface Store
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of item to push.
        toNodes - The nodes to which the item is to be pushed.

      • pushx

        public void pushx(long id,
         short toNode)
        Description copied from interface: Store
        Makes the given item available in the given node's cache, and makes that node the owner of the item.
        While this method is never necessary for the correct operation of the grid, in some special circumstances it might improve performance if we know that the given node will soon be interested in reading or updating the item (e.g. as a result of a message we're about to send it).
        Specified by:
        pushx in interface Store
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of item to push.
        toNode - The node to which the item is to be pushed.
